main event: A civilian couple observed an elliptical-shaped unidentified aircraft traveling at a tremendous speed over Lake Michigan near Wilmette, Illinois on 16 May 1950 for about 10 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described to be approximately 50 to 100 feet in diameter and had a slight pinkish hue.
It was traveling on a set course 5 to 8 miles from the shore at a high altitude, visible for about 10 seconds, and appeared to be some type of aircraft.
The flight of the unidentified aircraft was also witnessed by the occupants of another car near Lake Michigan.
The report references a previous letter from the office regarding a 'Flying Saucer' and requests information on the continuance of reporting such sightings.
The report indicates that there was no radar contact with the unidentified aircraft, and it was determined to possibly be a meteor.
